page.title: 05FORTHAMPTON VILLAGE HOUSES
page.content: The village has seen little change during the centuries with only a few houses being built and a few demolished. There are however a large number of interesting buildings for such a small village. The Sanctuary is thought to be the oldest house, built by Tewkesbury Abbey at the end of the 15th Century. Modernisation was carried out in 1973 without destroying its character. The forge however has lost all its original form and only the outbuildings remain as a memory of its use. Brewers cottage still has part of its wattle and daube consruction. Most of the houses are half timbered and a number are still thatched. Each one has its own interesting history and features worthy of further investigation in a village which is proud of its past and happy to share it.
